blog.description: This is where we discuss tropes, cliches, and writing topics. This is also where I will on occasion write updates on my fics on AO3 and maybe post snipets of my : original works. Icon and Header are both characters of mine, Jo and Ray respectfully. Support me on Patreon: www.patreon.com/awtusc

summary: Last night I woke up in a cold sweat after receiving divine inspiration.   Detective Pikachu sequel where Professor Oak’s...
body:
Last night I woke up in a cold sweat after receiving divine inspiration. 

Detective Pikachu sequel where Professor Oak’s granddaughter took up the mantle of Pokeom Professor after her grandfather’s retirement. She was researching into the creation of the Pokemon world but has since gone missing. Her brother, Blue Oak hires Tim and Harry Goodman to find his missing sister.

Opening Scene;

(Camera pans across a pokemon lab, Blue Oak provides a voice-over)

Blue: I heard about what happened in Ryme City, I heard about what you two did with Mewtwo. I have a mystery if you think you’re up for it.  My sister (camera pans over a picture of Blue Oak with Professor Oak and Blue’s sister) was researching the mythical Pokemon Arceus, but she went missing. (Camera continues to pan until it reaches a shot of Tim, Harry and Blue sitting at a table in the lab) If you two think you’re up to it, I want you to find out what happened to my sister. Think you’re up to the challenge.

(Camera zooms in on Tim and Harry, they exchange a look)

Harry: You’ve got yourself a detective team.

summary: The Pokemon Company Makes 5 Big Pokemon Announcements - New Games, Services, and More!
title: The Pokemon Company Makes 5 Big Pokemon Announcements - New Games, Services, and More!
body:
The Pokemon Company Makes 5 Big Pokemon Announcements – New Games, Services, and More!

Some major news has come out over the week from The Pokemon Company during a press conference in Tokyo Japan. Much of it was exciting, some of it was curious, yet it all shows that the world of Pokemon isn’t waiting for the future, they’re looking to shape it.

During their press event, The Pokemon Company outlined five major changes coming to the world of Pokemon. Some I’d say as a player is very…

View On WordPress

blog.name: starry-dreamer
blog.title: Starry Dreamer
blog.description: My name is Reneé. I am 34 and live in Southern California. I earned my B.A. in Literature & Writing Studies in 2011 and a Web Design and Development certificate in 2012. I enjoy reading, writing, singing, playing video games, using the computer and watching movies. I'm a Christian, a tech geek, an anime/manga fan, an Aspie (i.e., I have Asperger Syndrome), a girl gamer, and a big book lover. This is my first Tumblr blog, called "Starry Dreamer" because I think that describes me (I like stars and I'm the dreamer type). Hope you like it!~Portrait is a Public Domain image from Wikimedia Commons. It is of the painting La Liseuse (The Reader) by Claude Monet.~

body:
Ryme City headcanon

I have a theory that Ryme City is located in Unova. Detective Pikachu has many Pokémon you can encounter, and the majority of them are Gen 5 Pokémon. Detective Baker even has an Accelgor as a partner. There are some exceptions - Amanda’s Fletchling, Keith/Roger’s Noivern, the Trevenant and Fennekin from PCL, and the Noibat in Litwick Cave are all Gen 6 Pokémon, and there are a few Gen 7 Pokémon as well (the Brionne and Alolan Rattata on the cruise ship, the Stufful and Litten in Fine Park, etc). Plus Pablo’s Ludicolo and Brad’s Manectric are both Gen 3 (though given that this game was released in Japan in 2016, only a couple years after ORAS, this makes sense), and there are some Pokémon from other gens too, mostly Gen 1 (though there are exceptions, like the Spinarak who aids you at the Ryme Wharf factory).

The city has the feel of an American city, and Tim even arrives in town on an underground train, a.k.a. subway. You can also reach Cappucci Island by ferry, and you can take a ferry to different islands from the NYC area. GNN could be a play on CNN.

Anyway, just a theory.

summary: UPCOMING DETECTIVE PIKACHU SCREENINGS TO OFFER UP SOMETHING SPECIAL IN JAPAN
title: UPCOMING DETECTIVE PIKACHU SCREENINGS TO OFFER UP SOMETHING SPECIAL IN JAPAN
body: If you live in Japan and happen to be near Aeon Cinema Kohoku Town and Aeon Cinema Koshigaya Lake Town, you might want to make plans to check out Detective Pikachu on June 8th, 2019. Pokemon Co. has announced that screenings on that day will feature a Detective Pikachu mascot dancing along to the infamous Detective Pikachu dancing video. If you don’t know what we’re talking about, check it out below!

summary: Ah yes, the Galar region. Based upon the UK, which is world famous for their Kaiju Battles Is that why the Pokemon Company...
body:
Ah yes, the Galar region.

Based upon the UK, which is world famous for their

Kaiju Battles

Is that why the Pokemon Company teamed up with Toho?

But if Toho is part of the distribution of the Detective Pikachu movie, and it was announced that Detective Pikachu 2 was going to have a different ending…?

Does that mean-?!

“Tim, I am going to help you find your dad if it means tearing this whole god damn city apart!”

tags: like 10 minutes after pikachu first appeared on screen Friend made a joke along the lines of 'this pikachu is your dad now'
and we did NOT expect it to be as prophetic as it was
until about 5 minutes before the Big Reveal
at which point we were both like 'oh god we were kidding but this pikachu IS your dad now?!?'
not that is is possible to spoil this movie it is an incredibly predictable delight
the biggest surprise was the ditto and that was a VERY UPSETTING SURPRISE
summary: I saw Detective Pikachu yesterday! Because it was 1:30 on a Tuesday, there were literally no other people in the theater besides...
body:
I saw Detective Pikachu yesterday! Because it was 1:30 on a Tuesday, there were literally no other people in the theater besides me and my friend, so we got to treat it like a very large living room and yelled at the screen as much as we wanted. Which was good, as we called most plot points and a surprising amount of dialogue at least a minute in advance.

I did actually super enjoy it, though? Like, the plot was constructed out of spare parts and most of the characters had dialogue that I could visualize scrolling across the bottom of a Game Boy screen as they said it, and that mattered precisely 0% because I was there for the incredibly rad production design and visual worldbuilding and on that front I got absolutely everything I wanted.

also, AUGH DITTO WHY.

reblog.comment:
